Weinstein began collecting these violins to honor that tradition, but also to break the silence.
His family never spoke of the Holocaust.

Then Weinstein married Assi Bielski, whose father was a famous Jewish resistance fighter portrayed in the film ""Defiance."" Weinstein was amazed at how happily the Bielski family talked about the war.
We are completely different in this way.
Her family killed Germans, by quantities, not by one.
My family was all killed by the Germans.
My family - it's true what Amnon - the way Amnon described it, was always very happy.
They were not humiliated.
I think this is the big thing.
It's the number tattooed on your arm that is a constant reminder of the humiliation.
For us, there was none of it.
And maybe what I'm doing with violins, I'm doing it to make my life a little bit easier from all this heritage, which is unbelievable.
